awd_titl_txt: Nonlinear Dynamics of the Driven Sine-Gordon Chain          and Related Models (Materials Research)
awd_abstract_narration: The statistical physics of nonlinear chains is used to describe a               large range of dynamical systems including charge density wave                  materials, Josephson junctions and low-dimensional conductors.                  Nonlinear chains can exhibit kink or soliton-like solutions to                  their equations of motion.  The presence of these intrinsic                     nonlinear excitations is crucial to understanding the response of               these systems to external stimuli.  In this research program, Dr.               Miller is concerned with the nonequilibrium statistical physics                 of the sine-Gordon and sine-Toda systems as a function of                       external driving forces and various internal configurations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
